Package utilities

Interface StackADT<E>

Type Parameters:
E - The type of elements this stack holds.
All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
MyStack
public interface StackADT<E> extends Serializable
The StackADT interface defines the methods that a stack data structure should implement.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    clear()
    Removes all the elements in the stack.
    boolean
    isEmpty()
    Checks if the stack is empty.
    Iterator<E>
    iterator()
    Returns an iterator over the elements in this stack, in proper sequence.
    E
    peek()
    Returns the element at the top of the stack without removing it.
    E
    pop()
    Removes and returns the element at the top of the stack.
    boolean
    push(E toAdd)
    Adds the specific element at the top of the stack.
    int
    search(E toFind)
    Returns index of the specified element in this stack.
    int
    size()
    Returns the number of elements in the stack.

  • Method Details

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the number of elements in the stack.
      Returns:
      The number of elements in the stack. Preconditions: A valid StackADT object exists. Postconditions: StackADT size is returned.

    • clear

      void clear()
      Removes all the elements in the stack. Precondition: None Postcondition: The stack is empty.

    • push

      boolean push(E toAdd) throws NullPointerException
      Adds the specific element at the top of the stack.
      Parameters:
      element - The element that is to be added on top of the stack.
      Returns:
      true if element is appended successfully.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the specified element is null and the list implementation does not support having null elements. Precondition: None. Postcondition: The stack contains the element at the top.

    • search

      int search(E toFind) throws NullPointerException
      Returns index of the specified element in this stack.
      Parameters:
      toFind - The element whose presence in this list is to be found.
      Returns:
      Integer of the index of the specified element in this stack.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the specified element is null and the stack implementation does not support having null elements. Precondition: None. Postcondition: The stack remains unchanged.

    • peek

      E peek() throws EmptyStackException
      Returns the element at the top of the stack without removing it.
      Returns:
      The element at the top of the stack.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the stack is empty. Precondition: The stack is not empty. Postcondition: The stack remains unchanged or if empty, throws EmptyStackException.
      EmptyStackException

    • pop

      E pop() throws EmptyStackException
      Removes and returns the element at the top of the stack.
      Returns:
      The element at the top of the stack.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - if the stack is empty.
      EmptyStackException

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the stack is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the stack is empty, false otherwise.

    • iterator

      Iterator<E> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the elements in this stack, in proper sequence.
      Returns:
      An iterator over the elements in this stack, in proper sequence. NB: The return is of type linearUtilities.Iterator, not java.util.Iterator.
